defaultPosition.description:
ICE's Office of the Principal Legal Advisor (OPLA) is the largest legal program in the Department of Homeland Security, providing legal advice, training and services in cases related to the ICE mission.

OPLA also is the exclusive legal representative for the U.S. government in exclusion, deportation and removal proceedings before the Department of Justiceâs Executive Office for Immigration Review. 

Moreover, OPLA attorneys litigate immigration-related hearings that involve criminal aliens, terrorists and human rights abusers.

OPLA also provides critical legal support to ICE components focusing on customs, worksite enforcement, ethics, employment law, tort claims and administrative law issues.
defaultPosition.title: Assistant Chief Counsel

positions.title: Assistant Chief Counsel

positions.companyName: Kings County, Office of the District Attorney
positions.description: Investigated and prosecuted allegations of public assistance fraud, including Medicaid, Section 8, Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program benefit fraud. Secured over 100 felony indictments and convictions resulting in the recovery of over $2 million for city and state agencies. Supervised and trained attorneys and investigators. Regularly collaborated with city, state, and federal agencies.
positions.title: Deputy Bureau Chief

positions.companyName: Office of the Kings County District Attorney
positions.description: Led and conducted long-term investigations of criminal conduct targeting immigrants and individuals without legal status. Investigated and prosecuted healthcare and welfare fraud, embezzlement, identity theft, loan fraud, and money laundering.
positions.title: Senior Assistant District Attorney

positions.description: Provided support and assistance in all aspects of commercial litigation, business law, and franchise law, including document organization and production, and the researching, editing, and drafting of various pleadings and correspondence.
positions.title: Paralegal
